meanings.definition: A large, heavy hammer used for shaping metal.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith used a beal to shape the red-hot metal.
meanings.sent2: The beal was too heavy for the apprentice to lift.
meanings.sent3: The beal looked like a giant's tool in the small workshop.
meanings.sent4: The beal came down on the metal like a thunderous clap.
meanings.sent5: The clang of the beal echoed through the forge.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a heavy hammer.
meanings.sent1: He tried to beal the metal into shape but lacked strength.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would beal the metal until it was perfectly formed.
meanings.sent3: The apprentice accidentally beal his thumb instead of the metal.
meanings.sent4: She beal the drum with such force that it reverberated through the room.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the beal filled the workshop.

meanings.definition: A swelling or lump, especially on the body.
meanings.sent1: The athlete had a painful beal on his knee after the game.
meanings.sent2: She applied ice to the beal to reduce the swelling.
meanings.sent3: The beal on his forehead made him look like he had grown a horn.
meanings.sent4: The beal on the tree trunk showed where it had been struck by lightning.
meanings.sent5: The beal was tender to the touch and needed time to heal.
